profile_overview: The safest way to earn yield on-chain. Not available to US residents.
profile_bio:
Lift Dollar (USDL) is a US dollar-backed stablecoin that provides easy access to safe yield generated from cash and cash equivalent assets. Our vision is to make financial growth accessible, secure, equitable and efficient.

USDL is issued by Paxos International, a regulated entity overseen by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) in the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM). Terms and conditions apply. Learn more at liftdollar.com.

extracted_posts.post_content:
ICYMI: USDL is now available onRipio, one of Latin America’s largest crypto platforms 🎉 

More details on this exciting new partnership below 👇

Note: USDL is not available to residents of the US and certain other countries. 55,239 followers 🚀 Felices de anunciar la incorporación de una nueva opción a nuestra cartera de criptomonedas: Lift Dollar (USDL), una stablecoin emitida y respaldada porPaxosInternacional.

👉 Desde hoy, nuestros usuarios podrán acceder de manera segura y eficiente a dólares estadounidenses con USDL, además de tener la oportunidad de generar rendimientos diarios en la sección DeFi de nuestra app.

En alianza con Paxos, esta colaboración representa otro paso adelante en nuestra misión de expandir el desarrollo del mercado cripto en la región y también confirma nuestro liderazgo en Latam reforzando nuestros 11 años de experiencia en la industria.

We're excited to share that USDL is now available in Argentina via our distribution partners 🇦🇷
✔️Ripio✔️Buenbit✔️Plus✔️MantecaLearn more here:bit.ly/3Rl27yQ

The current stablecoin model is broken, with adoption primarily benefiting issuers. Read on about why USDL exists to change that:bit.ly/3yNO0M1USDL is not available to residents of the US and certain other countries.

Introducing Lift Dollar (#USDL), a US dollar-backed stablecoin with regulatory oversight that distributes yield from its cash and cash equivalent reserves on-chain, every single day. 

USDL gives users direct access to both US dollars and safe yield from US Treasuries and other cash equivalent assets from outside the US. 1 USDL is always worth 1 US dollar. USDL is issued by Paxos International, a regulated entity overseen by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority in theADGM, ensuring the highest standards of consumer protection.

Our vision is to create a more inclusive and accessible financial system, democratizing access to US dollars. USDL enables broad availability and access for token holders to earn safe, daily yield. No minimum investment amount. No transfer restrictions.

Visitliftdollar.comto learn more about USDL and how to access it.

White Paper:whitepaper.liftdollar.com/Token Symbol: USDL
Contract Address: 0xbdC7c08592Ee4aa51D06C27Ee23D5087D65aDbcDTBD
GitHub:https://lnkd.in/gwB9_krKEtherscan:https://lnkd.in/ewuCQ4eqNote: USDL is not available to residents of the US, UK, EU, UAE, Canada, Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore and other specific countries.

👉 Desde hoy, nuestros usuarios podrán acceder de manera segura y eficiente a dólares estadounidenses con USDL, además de tener la oportunidad de generar rendimientos diarios en la sección DeFi de nuestra app.

The current stablecoin model is broken, with adoption primarily benefiting issuers. Read on about why USDL exists to change that:bit.ly/3yNO0M1USDL is not available to residents of the US and certain other countries.

Introducing Lift Dollar (#USDL), a US dollar-backed stablecoin with regulatory oversight that distributes yield from its cash and cash equivalent reserves on-chain, every single day. 

USDL gives users direct access to both US dollars and safe yield from US Treasuries and other cash equivalent assets from outside the US. 1 USDL is always worth 1 US dollar. USDL is issued by Paxos International, a regulated entity overseen by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority in theADGM, ensuring the highest standards of consumer protection.

Our vision is to create a more inclusive and accessible financial system, democratizing access to US dollars. USDL enables broad availability and access for token holders to earn safe, daily yield. No minimum investment amount. No transfer restrictions.

Visitliftdollar.comto learn more about USDL and how to access it.

GitHub:https://lnkd.in/gwB9_krKEtherscan:https://lnkd.in/ewuCQ4eqNote: USDL is not available to residents of the US, UK, EU, UAE, Canada, Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore and other specific countries.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts into different themes related to cryptocurrency (e.g., regulation, technological advancements, market predictions). Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output:
The posts can be categorized into:

1. **Regulation**: Stablecoin regulatory frameworks and HKMA's legislative regime.
2. **Technological Advancements**: Co-existence with CBDCs and powering Web 2.5 to 3.0.
3. **Market Predictions**: Expanding use cases and transformative economic impact.

These themes reflect stablecoins' regulatory, technological, and market trend aspects.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Investors prioritize stability, regulatory clarity, and informed decision-making over speculative gains, showing confidence in stablecoins. They value educational insights and economic impact, reflecting a preference for transparency and long-term growth in the evolving crypto market.

prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include increased focus on stablecoins' economic impact, regulatory developments, and market growth, highlighting investor confidence and preference for fiat-pegged crypto assets. Emphasis is on education and industry insights, with no mention of new controversies or significant milestones.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts do not exhibit patterns or strategies typical of cryptocurrency manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. They focus on education, regulatory discussions, and expert webinars without exaggerated claims or high-return promises, indicating an informative rather than manipulative approach.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts do not show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. They contain specific details, varied content, and personalized language, indicating human authorship.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts contain invite links to a webinar on the stablecoin landscape in APAC, not to cryptocurrency channels or groups. They focus on education and regulatory discussions, showing no signs of involvement in manipulation schemes.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: These posts fall under "Stablecoins and Market Trends," focusing on stablecoins' economic impact, regulatory developments, and market growth, reflecting investor confidence, preference for stability, regulatory clarity, and educational insights over speculative gains and manipulative tactics.

overall_prompt_summary: The posts are human-generated, focusing on educational content about the stablecoin landscape in APAC, featuring industry experts. They lack characteristics of automated accounts or cryptocurrency manipulation tactics. The most important issues are the absence of exaggerated claims or high-return promises, and the emphasis on regulatory discussions and expert webinars. The posts do not link to cryptocurrency channels or groups, nor do they show patterns typical of pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. A potential improvement could be to include more diverse content types to further engage the audience.

Our vision is to create a more inclusive and accessible financial system, democratizing access to US dollars. USDL enables broad availability and access for token holders to earn safe, daily yield. No minimum investment amount. No transfer restrictions.

Visitliftdollar.comto learn more about USDL and how to access it.

Introducing Lift Dollar (#USDL), a US dollar-backed stablecoin with regulatory oversight that distributes yield from its cash and cash equivalent reserves on-chain, every single day. 

USDL gives users direct access to both US dollars and safe yield from US Treasuries and other cash equivalent assets from outside the US. 1 USDL is always worth 1 US dollar. USDL is issued by Paxos International, a regulated entity overseen by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority in theADGM, ensuring the highest standards of consumer protection.

Our vision is to create a more inclusive and accessible financial system, democratizing access to US dollars. USDL enables broad availability and access for token holders to earn safe, daily yield. No minimum investment amount. No transfer restrictions.

Visitliftdollar.comto learn more about USDL and how to access it.

Dans le cadre notre collaboration mensuelle avec l’Agence Science-Presse,Sylvain Cordiernous présente de manière vulgarisée le projet de#recherchesur lequel il travaille actuellement au LIRIDE. 
 
« En partenariat avec l’Institut quantique - Université de Sherbrooke, le LIRIDE a mis en place un projet de comparaison des impacts environnementaux entre un ordinateur quantique et un supercalculateur. La revue bibliographique a montré des exemples d’#ACVpour les équipements informatiques classiques mais pas pour les ordinateurs quantiques. » 
 
Pour lire l’article, c’est par ici! 👇https://lnkd.in/epByqh2JAs part of our monthly collaboration withAgence Science-Presse,Sylvain Cordiergives us a simplified introduction to the#researchproject he is currently working on at LIRIDE.  
  
“In partnership with theInstitut quantique - Université de Sherbrooke, LIRIDE has set up a project to compare the environmental impacts of a quantum computer and a supercomputer. The literature review showed examples of#LCAsfor conventional computing equipment, but not for quantum computers.”  
  
To read the article, click here! 👇https://lnkd.in/epByqh2J

On entend de plus en plus parler de l'empreinte carbone numérique qui croît de manière exponentielle. Récemment,La Presses'est questionnée sur la croyance populaire qui place l'envoi et le stockage des courriels comme au cœur de cet enjeu. 📨 
 
D’où proviennent les émissions de carbone liées au monde numérique? Comment les réduire? Les personnes étudiant en génie informatique de laFaculté de génie - Université de Sherbrookes'intéressent à la performance et à l'empreinte carbone des serveurs dès leur première année d'études dans le cadre du cours GEN 272. 🖥️ 
 
C'est en invitant la relève en génie à se questionner et en l’outillant avec ces connaissances qu'elle sera capable de concevoir des solutions numériques plus durables et respectueuses de l'environnement. ♻️ 
 
Et pour une partie de la réponse, c’est par ici! 👇https://lnkd.in/eHmrtFTa------

We're hearing more and more about the digital carbon footprint, which is growing exponentially. Recently,La Presseasked about the popular belief that sending and storing e-mails is at the heart of this issue.  📨 
  
Where do the carbon emissions linked to the digital world come from? How can we reduce them? Computer engineering students atFaculté de génie - Université de Sherbrookehave been looking at the performance and carbon footprint of servers since their first year as part of the GEN 272 course. 🖥️ 
  
By inviting the next generation of engineers to ask questions and equipping them with this knowledge, they will be able to design more sustainable, environmentally-friendly digital solutions. ♻️ 
 
For part of the answer, click here! 👇https://lnkd.in/eHmrtFTa

We are pleased to introduceRené Gómez Rodríguez, who joins the LIRIDE team. Originally from Mexico, René holds a degree in Sustainable Development Engineering fromTecnológico de Monterrey.  
  
“I'm very excited to contribute to society through LIRIDE, helping to make this world a better and more sustainable place.”  
  
✨ René is starting a PhD course focused on researching the impacts of climate change on the building sector. His interest in LIRIDE is based on our shared commitment to advancing knowledge in life cycle assessment and the circular economy. René shares our vision of developing and promoting innovative and sustainable solutions, and we are convinced that he will be a valuable asset to our team.   
  
Outside of his research, René has a passion for nature photography and film, activities that stimulate his creativity and inspiration. 📷  
  
We are happy to welcome René to the LIRIDE team and look forward to collaborating with him to achieve our common goals! 💚

-----------

Nous sommes ravis de vous présenterRené Gómez Rodríguezqui rejoint l’équipe du LIRIDE. Originaire du Mexique, René est diplômé en génie du développement durable deTecnológico de Monterrey. 
 
« Je suis très enthousiaste à l'idée de contribuer à la société à travers LIRIDE, en aidant à rendre ce monde meilleur et plus durable. » 
 
✨ René se lance dans un parcours de doctorat axé sur l’étude des impacts du changement climatique sur le secteur du bâtiment. Son intérêt pour LIRIDE repose sur notre engagement commun en faveur de l’avancement des connaissances en analyse du cycle de vie et en économie circulaire. René partage notre vision de développer et de promouvoir des solutions innovantes et durables, et nous sommes convaincus qu’il sera un atout précieux pour notre équipe.  
 
En dehors de ses recherches, René nourrit une passion pour la photographie de nature et le cinéma, des activités qui stimulent sa créativité et son inspiration. 📷 
 
Nous sommes heureux d’accueillir René dans l’équipe du LIRIDE et avons hâte de collaborer avec lui pour atteindre nos objectifs communs! 💚#lca#acv#research#recherche#doctorat#changementsclimatiques#climatechange

Plus que quelques jours avant la rentrée! Pour l’occasion, nous voulons souligner l’importance accordée par laFaculté de génie - Université de Sherbrookeà l’intégration des considérations environnementales à la formation de la relève en#génie. 🏫 

Cet automne se tiendra le cours GCB450 - Analyse du cycle de vie des procédés portant exclusivement sur l’#ACV, offert en génie biotechnologique et en génie chimique. De plus, des interventions ponctuelles (module ACV) sont également prévues pour d’autres cours offerts durant la session, dont en génie civil, en génie du bâtiment et en génie mécanique.

L'équipe du LIRIDE est impatiente de commencer l'année et d'enrichir votre parcours universitaire pour vous permettre de contribuer à un avenir plus#durable! 🌎

La production de semi-conducteurs a des impacts environnementaux méconnus. En effet leur fabrication est énergivore et génératrice de déchets chimiques. Pourtant ces composants électroniques sont indispensables pour de nombreux appareils électriques. 📺 
 
Pour développer des stratégies d’atténuations d’impacts environnementaux, il est donc important de revoir leurs étapes clés de fabrication.   
 
Pour en savoir plus, consultez cet article queMathieu Courchesne, directeur du développement du LIRIDE, a écrit dans le cadre de notre collaboration avecAgence Science-Presse. 💻 
 
👉https://lnkd.in/eZvMyjPq----

The production of semiconductors has significant but often overlooked environmental impacts. Their manufacturing is energy-intensive and generates chemical waste, yet these electronic components are essential for numerous electrical devices. 📺 

To develop strategies for mitigating environmental impacts, it is important to review their key manufacturing steps. 

To learn more, check out this article by Mathieu Courchesne, Director of Development at LIRIDE, written as part of our collaboration with Agence Science-Presse. 💻  

👉https://lnkd.in/eZvMyjPq

🚧 Creusage de tunnels et impact environnemental 🚧 
Les travaux de creusage de tunnels, qu'ils soient réalisés avec de la dynamite ou un tunnelier, ont un impact bien réel sur environnement et émettent une quantité importante de gaz à effet de serre. Pourtant, cette question environnementale est peu abordée dans l'industrie de la construction au Québec, malgré les objectifs de carboneutralité. Quelle méthode est donc préférable à utiliser ? 🏗 
 
Dans cette entrevue,Ben Amor, professeur à laFaculté de génie - Université de Sherbrookeet directeur du LIRIDE, nous éclaire sur ce sujet. 
Consultez l'article ici :https://lnkd.in/eCGpBJSB--- 
 
🚧 Tunnel Excavation and Environmental Impact 🚧 
  
Tunnel excavation work, whether using dynamite or a tunnel boring machine (TBM), has a significant impact on the environment and emits a large amount of greenhouse gases. However, this environmental issue is rarely addressed in the construction industry in Quebec, despite its carbon neutrality goals. So, which method is preferable to use? 🏗 
  
In this interview, Ben Amor, Professor at theFaculté de génie - Université de Sherbrookeand Director of LIRIDE, sheds light on this topic. 
  
Read the article here:https://lnkd.in/eCGpBJSBAssociation des constructeurs de routes et grands travaux du Québec (ACRGTQ)Infrastructure OntarioSociété québécoise des infrastructuresHousing, Infrastructure and Communities Canada | Logement, Infrastructures et Collectivités CanadaCDPQ InfraMinistère des Transports et de la Mobilité durable du Québec (MTMD)Lucille Baucal--Poyac#environnement#infrastructure#tunnels 4,334 followers Les travaux de creusage de tunnels ont un impact bien réel sur l'#environnement. Or, l'industrie de la#constructions'en soucie peu dans un Québec qui, pourtant, vise la#carboneutralité.

Le LIRIDE est rattaché à laFaculté de génie - Université de Sherbrookeet se spécialise dans l'analyse du cycle de vie et ses applications dans divers secteurs comme les bâtiments, l'énergie et les technologies numériques. En plus de contribuer à la recherche scientifique, le LIRIDE soutient également l'industrie et les organisations dans leur engagement vers des pratiques durables et favorise le transfert de connaissances et la formation aux meilleures pratiques de l'ACV et de l'économie circulaire. 🌱 



The LIRIDE is affiliated with theFaculté de génie - Université de Sherbrookeand specializes in life cycle assessment and its applications in various sectors such as buildings, energy, and digital technologies. In addition to contributing to scientific research, the LIRIDE also supports industry and organizations in their commitment to sustainable practices and promotes knowledge transfer and training in the best practices of life cycle analysis and circular economy. 🌱

Ce 1er août marque cette année le Jour du Dépassement de la Terre. Selon le Global Footprint Network (GFN), cette journée correspond à l'épuisement des ressources naturelles par la consommation humaine. L'humanité a consommé autant de ressources naturelles que ce que les écosystèmes de la planète peuvent renouveler en une année entière. En seulement 7 mois, nous avons donc utilisé ce que la Terre met 12 mois à régénérer.  🌎

Au LIRIDE, nous sommes engagés dans la recherche sur le développement durable et pour un avenir plus respectueux de l'environnement. Nos projets visent à évaluer les impacts environnementaux, en intégrant des stratégies innovantes et durables afin de les réduire.

---
This August 1st marks this year’s Earth Overshoot Day. According to the Global Footprint Network (GFN), this day corresponds to the exhaustion of natural resources due to human consumption. We globally have consumed as many natural resources as the planet's ecosystems can renew in an entire year. In just 7 months, we have used what Earth takes 12 months to regenerate. 🌎 

At LIRIDE, we are committed to research for sustainable development and to create a more environmentally friendly future. Our projects aim to assess environmental impacts by integrating innovative and sustainable strategies to mitigate them.

Réaliser une analyse du cycle de vie (ACV) d'un bâtiment demande du temps et des données, mais c'est la méthode la plus complète pour estimer les impacts environnementaux. Pour simplifier ce processus, des outils permettent de comparer et d'estimer les émissions de GES de manière plus efficace. 🌍 

Les déclarations environnementales de produits (DEP) offrent une autre voie pour simplifier la quantification des impacts. Ces documents, vérifiés par une tierce partie, fournissent des informations environnementales basées sur une ACV déjà réalisée, rendant l'évaluation moins coûteuse et plus rapide. 

Pour en savoir plus sur l'utilisation des DEP et des outils d'ACV pour évaluer les impacts environnementaux des bâtiments, consultez cet article que notre doctoranteKikki Ipsena écrit dans le cadre de notre collaboration avecAgence Science-Presse. 💻 
 
👉https://lnkd.in/gQzxWc5Q----

Performing a life cycle assessment (LCA) of a building requires time and data, but it is the most comprehensive method for estimating environmental impacts. To simplify this process, tools are available to more effectively compare and estimate greenhouse gas emissions. 🌍 
  
Environmental product declarations (EPDs) offer another way to streamline impact quantification. These third-party verified documents provide environmental information based on an already completed LCA, making assessments less costly and faster. 
  
To learn more about using EPDs and LCA tools to evaluate building environmental impacts, check out the article written by our PhD Kikki Lambrecht Ipsen in collaboration with Agence Science Presse. 💻 
👉https://lnkd.in/gQzxWc5Q#LCA#Building#Environment#ACV#EcoDesign#Innovation#Bâtiment#Environnement

Congratulations toKikki Ipsenon earning her PhD in Civil Engineering! 
  
Her thesis, entitled "Multi-scale evaluation of the environmental consequences of eco-design strategies for the built environment" quantifies the environmental impacts of eco-design strategies in the building sector and recommends prioritizing the use of biotic materials to reduce environmental impacts, while differentiating strategies according to building components. 🏢 
  
We would like to express our gratitude and congratulations for her achievement. We also extend our thanks to the jury members. 💚 
________

According to theOffice québécois de la langue française,#ecodesignis "the design of products or processes characterized by the desire to reduce or prevent environmental#impactsthroughout their life cycle". More widely, ecodesign generally includes impacts related to energy consumption, human health and ecosystems quality. 💡 

Ecodesign can cover a very wide range of aspects: product packaging, local sourcing of raw materials, choice of materials for a building, energy consumption of the various manufacturing processes, design and material choices that ensure that the product created is more durable over time, repairable, recyclable, etc.#lca

Our doctorate studentKikki Ipsenand professorBen Amorin collaboration withMorten Birkved, professor at Life Cycle Engineering, Department of Green TechnologiesSyddansk Universitet - University of Southern Denmark, andMassimo Pizzol, professor atAalborg University, have published their latest paper on "Environmental performance of eco-design strategies applied to the building sector".  💻https://lnkd.in/eFF9WR4u

L’analyse du cycle de vie, c’est notre expertise au LIRIDE. 💻
 
L’#ACVest une méthode qui prend en compte toutes les étapes du cycle de vie d’un produit, de l’extraction des matériaux jusqu’à la fin de vie et qui permet de quantifier l’ensemble des impacts sur l’environnement, sur les écosystèmes, sur les ressources, sur la santé humaine etc. 
 
Pour y parvenir, il faut d'abord dresser l'inventaire du cycle de vie, c'est-à-dire dresser la liste de toutes les émissions et les ressources utilisées aux différentes étapes du cycle de vie d'un produit (extraction, production, transport, utilisation et fin de vie) puis déterminer tous les impacts générés. L'analyse et l'interprétation des données obtenues permettent ensuite d'émettre des recommandations basées sur des données probantes. 📈
 
Nous sommes profondément convaincus que les décisions dans tous les secteurs d’activités devraient prendre en compte l’ACV. 
 
C’est pourquoi nous développons des outils simplifiés tout en reposant sur des données robustes qui permettent de démocratiser l’ACV et de la rendre accessible au plus grand nombre de personnes professionnelles possible. 
 
D’un autre côté, nous sommes tout à fait conscients de la limite de certains outils ou modèles. C’est pourquoi nous repoussons toujours les limites de ce champ en développant de nouveaux outils, en combinant les approches et les modèles afin de fournir des données de plus en plus précises et complètes qui tiennent compte de l’immense variété des contextes d’application.

profile_overview: The safest way to earn yield on-chain. Not available to US residents.
profile_bio:
Lift Dollar (USDL) is a US dollar-backed stablecoin that provides easy access to safe yield generated from cash and cash equivalent assets. Our vision is to make financial growth accessible, secure, equitable and efficient.

USDL is issued by Paxos International, a regulated entity overseen by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) in the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM). Terms and conditions apply. Learn more at liftdollar.com.

The current stablecoin model is broken, with adoption primarily benefiting issuers. Read on about why USDL exists to change that:bit.ly/3yNO0M1USDL is not available to residents of the US and certain other countries.

Introducing Lift Dollar (#USDL), a US dollar-backed stablecoin with regulatory oversight that distributes yield from its cash and cash equivalent reserves on-chain, every single day. 

USDL gives users direct access to both US dollars and safe yield from US Treasuries and other cash equivalent assets from outside the US. 1 USDL is always worth 1 US dollar. USDL is issued by Paxos International, a regulated entity overseen by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority in theADGM, ensuring the highest standards of consumer protection.

Our vision is to create a more inclusive and accessible financial system, democratizing access to US dollars. USDL enables broad availability and access for token holders to earn safe, daily yield. No minimum investment amount. No transfer restrictions.

Visitliftdollar.comto learn more about USDL and how to access it.

White Paper:whitepaper.liftdollar.com/Token Symbol: USDL
